Content.Text:
<FACE_KAMIL><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
Hey, <MYNAME>. On your way into town?

<FACE_KAMIL><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
Me? I was out for a walk when I started thinking
about my old hometown. I guess I got a little
lost in thought.
<PAGE>
<FACE_LAUGH>This place is surrounded by so much nature.
The path out here reminds me a lot of the
mountain back home.

<FACE_KAMIL><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
It's been a long time since I left home to travel
and study my trade.
<PAGE>
<FACE_SAD>So every now and again, when I'm out in places
like this, I can't help but get a little homesick.
But you still work hard.
You just have to work harder!

<FACE_KAMIL><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
Well, my dream is to win a big flower
arrangement tournament someday, after all.
<PAGE>
To do that, I have to get out and experience new
cultures, new styles, new forms of art,
everything!
<PAGE>
So no matter how much I miss it, I can't just
run home. I have to keep on working and
learning every day.

<FACE_KAMIL><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
It's really not that big of a thing. I mean, your
dream of becoming a farmer brought you out
here too, right?

<FACE_KAMIL><POS_LEFT><FACE_LAUGH>
I think you're a lot more amazing than I am,
really.
<PAGE>
Moving out to some country town you've never
been to before, all by yourself, just to live your
dream.
<PAGE>
And farming isn't easy work. But I never hear
you complain at all. You just keep working as
hard as you can. That's inspiring.

<FACE_KAMIL><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
To be honest, I thought you might laugh at me
when I said I was homesick. That compliment
you gave me was a nice surprise.

<FACE_KAMIL><POS_LEFT><FACE_LOSS>
I've heard some say that it's childish for a grown
man to pine for home...

<FACE_KAMIL><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
But me, I think feeling a longing for home just
shows how special of a place it is.

<FACE_KAMIL><POS_LEFT><FACE_LAUGH>
Yeah. It was a really nice village.
<PAGE>
<FACE_NORMAL>I grew up surrounded by so many beautiful
flowers. That's how my dream came to be.
<PAGE>
And my friends and my...my family really
supported me in it, too.

<FACE_KAMIL><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
Oh, I kinda stuttered over the "family" bit there
because my real family died when I was still
little.
<PAGE>
Some family friends raised me. They were really
kind to me, but I'm still not sure if I could call
them "family" or not.
<PAGE>
<FACE_LAUGH>Of course, if the two of them heard that, they'd
probably yell, "Why not?!"

<FACE_KAMIL><POS_LEFT><FACE_LOSS>
Oops! Sorry, I really rambled on about myself
there, didn't I?
<PAGE>
<FACE_NORMAL>I've never been really good at talking to other
people...
<PAGE>
But for some reason, whenever I'm around you,
<MYNAME>, I go off on long, rambling
tangents. I'm sorry about that.
<PAGE>
Don't mind me. I didn't mean to talk your ear off.
I liked learning about you.
I'm sorry I bothered you.

<FACE_KAMIL><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
Really? Why?

<FACE_KAMIL><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
You think it brings us closer together?
<PAGE>
<FACE_LOVE>R-really? I, um...I'm really glad you think that.

<FACE_KAMIL><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
Hey, <MYNAME>? Do you think sometime, you
might let me hear a little more about you?
<PAGE>
<FACE_LAUGH>I think it'd be nice to get to know you a little
better, too.

<FACE_KAMIL><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
Oh, wow. Is it this late already? Time really flew
by, didn't it?
<PAGE>
<MYNAME>, I'm glad I got to talk to you today.

<FACE_KAMIL><POS_LEFT><FACE_LAUGH>
Thanks, for a lot of stuff. See you later,
<MYNAME>.

<FACE_KAMIL><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
No, you don't need to apologize. I was the one
who started blabbing away.

<FACE_KAMIL><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
I'll try to stop doing that to you. Anyways, I
should get going.
<PAGE>
Thanks for listening, though. See ya.

<FACE_KAMIL><POS_LEFT><FACE_SAD>
Yeah...I should, shouldn't I?
<PAGE>
<FACE_NORMAL>Hanging around here just makes me think about
home that much more, so I'd better get going.
<PAGE>
See you, <MYNAME>.
